title: Israeli army says it will prepare Rafah operation
summary: Israel's Defense Minister Yoav Gallant said Sunday that Israeli troops pulled out of Khan Yunis in southern Gaza Sunday to prepare for future missions, 'including in Rafah'.

title: Rwanda: Thirty years after Tutsi genocide, Paul Kagame blames the international community
summary: During the commemoration of the 30th anniversary of the genocide, the Rwandan government defended its right to defend itself in light of allegations of supporting a rebel group destabilizing eastern Congo.

title: 'The vast majority of Israel's Jewish population don't want to see the Gazans' suffering'
summary: French-Israeli historian and sociologist Jérôme Bourdon analyses the Israeli media's coverage of the war in Gaza, arguing it excludes any Israeli responsibility for the conflict.

title: Slovakia: Peter Pellegrini's presidential victory affirms government's pro-Russian shift
summary: With over 53 % of the vote, the candidate backed by pro-Russian Prime Minister Robert Fico won the election, confirming local support for the government's authoritarian drift.

title: Macron pays tribute to victims of Nazi raid on Jewish orphanage
summary: The event is among the first of a sequence of ceremonies the French president will lead this year to mark the 80th anniversary of D-Day, which eventually led to the end of WWII.

title: The fabricated finances of the fake Van Gogh brasserie in Arles
summary: In the historic center of the ancient French city, the café recreated according to the famous painting by the Dutch painter has closed. Accused of fraud, the establishment never aroused enthusiasm from locals.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine will lose the war if US Congress keeps blocking aid
summary: Republicans in Congress have been blocking tens of billions of dollars in military aid for months.

title: Elon Musk calls for impeachment of Brazilian Supreme Court judge
summary: Critics, now including Musk, have said Alexandre de Moraes is part of a sweeping crackdown against free speech in Brazil.

title: Mozambique: More than 90 killed as boat sinks off coast
summary: Most passengers were trying to escape the mainland because of a panic caused by disinformation about cholera, Nampula province's secretary of state said.

title: Alexis Gruss, the patriarch of French circus, has died
summary: From his first show in 1974, to 2024, when his company won its highest award at the International Circus Festival of Monte-Carlo, Gruss left his mark on equestrian circus. He died on Saturday, April 6, aged 79.

title: Marie Pezé, burn-out specialist: 'Presenteeism at work penalizes women who work a double day'
summary: The psychoanalyst believes that 'what women go through at work increases anxiety and depressive disorders.' In an interview, she explains that acute stress can have repercussions on their health, and even prevent them from getting pregnant.

title: The new face of beauty
summary: Behind the increasing number of bankruptcies of traditional salons, the entire French beauty market is being recomposed under the influence of social media.

title: Paris is considering pulling a monumental Richard Serra sculpture out of storage
summary: Following the death of its creator, the fate of his work 'Clara-Clara,' made up of two 36-meter curved steel structures weighing 108 tonnes, has resurfaced.

title: Unification is a 'legitimate aspiration' but no priority, future Irish PM says
summary: Simon Harris spoke to Sky News on Sunday, in his first interview since he was appointed Fine Gael party leader.

title: Forty years ago, the West discovered the images of the great Ethiopian famine
summary: Ethiopia is once again on the brink of famine, forty years after the disaster that claimed the lives of over 300,000 people in 1984.

title: The legal agony of opponent Jimmy Lai in Hong Kong
summary: The 76-year-old businessman and media magnate has been in prison since 2020. Already convicted four times, this time he faces life imprisonment for 'colluding with foreign forces.'

title: Russia declares federal emergency in flood-hit Orenburg region
summary: The floods, caused by a dam burst in the city of Orsk, forced over 4,500 people to evacuate so far.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.
